author: M M.
review text:
"That dinner was malicious" - a member of my party.

Overall Rating: 1.5/5

As far as Korean BBQ goes, this may be the worst experience I've had. All you can eat KBBQ doesn't warrant high quality meat, but some meats I couldn't be paid to bite through. Don't order the steak. This is the least full I have ever been after AYCE.

My party ordered:
-"Gen Premium" Steak - 0/5
- Beef bulgogi - 3/5
- Spicy Pork bulgogi - 3/5
- Brisket - 2/5

- Popcorn Chicken - 1/5
- Calamari - 1/5
- Yangyum Galbi - N/A
- Nook Gan Sal - 2/5

Let me start by saying this place is objectively not clean. I felt my shoes slipping on oil or grease. Please clean your floors. I wonder if that's why the lights are so dim in here. We get to the table and there are no tongs?

The side dishes were okay--definitely nothing to write home about. They gave us free rice at the start, which would've been nice had we not finished our rice, then requested more. This request was met with a 15-20 minute wait. This is somewhat unacceptable for a bowl of rice at this establishment, I would like to think. It appeared that there aren't that many dishes made by chefs, so one would think that having some rice going is pretty easy, but maybe the kitchen is understaffed or something. We also didn't get any sauce dishes. I feel these are pretty standard at kbbq. Pretty sure U-Grill down the street has sauce dishes or at least salt to dilute the blandness of some meats.

The meat that came was ok at best. Definitely lower end of meat quality. The best item out of those that we ordered was the spicy pork bulgogi, followed by the beef bulgogi. The marinades carry their flavor. All non-marinated items were pretty bland and chewy. The galbi never even came to our table.

Finally, the calamari was suspect at best and the popcorn chicken was oily and gross. Presentation was as shown in the pictures, which is to say, terrible.

Service - 1/5
Nathan must've been new, because better service should be expected of tenured waiters. On numerous occasions, we would order and then he would disappear without returning for over half an hour (just too long to be ok). I'm not sure how their service system works, but we received the wrong food on numerous occasions (3 i think). We never got the galbi despite waiting for ~40 total minutes for our second round. The calamari and popcorn chicken came at the very end of our meal after we had all but paid. A member of our party had to go to the bar to get a beer because they never brought it.

I would be happy to dine here again.

Overall, the food is lovely, we tried to make the best out of this experience, but I must say this was quite disappointing/:

I've been a waitress in the past so stating my experience from my point of view as someone who's worked in this field is unfortunate and my expectations were literally the minimum Requirements for a dine in.

Anyways, hopefully this is a one time thing and doesn't occur again to not only us but anyone, for the price we paid, I truly believe this was unacceptable.

If you order before 8:00 pm the day before and spend at least $100, they deliver to you. My delivery was free because I live right near the Rancho Cucamonga location. EVEN BETTER! I ordered my favorites the Hawaiian Steak, Bulgogi, Cajun Shrimp, Cajun Chicken, Garlic Chicken, Honey Chicken, Gen Steak, Beef Short Ribs, Beef Brisket, Beef Cheek, Spicy Chicken and all the sides. Everything came neatly wrapped in a box surrounded with temperature controlled packaging. Temperature of the meat was nice and cold. I bought some smokeless grills, there the meat on them, and it was just like being at Gen! I have ordered several times since and great experience everytime!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nathan C.
review text:
The meats at Gen are always good and fresh. Pair this with good company that can eat and it'll be a great time!

We usually start off by ordering a few rounds of brisket since it cooks the fastest. Then we follow up with other red meats such as bulgogi and steaks. I'm not a huge fan of cooking chicken, because it takes a while and there is a chance of cross contamination. My favorite sides are kimchi, rice paper, and rice. It's $22 for AYCE, so it's a fair price, especially if you eat a lot!

I'm usually not a huge fan of the service, because it gets busy and the workers get frustrated. However, we had a great server this time around and it was nice. His name is Josh and he was very patient with the big party we had. He got all our meats out in a timely manner and he had a great attitude the whole night.

You will most likely smell like BBQ after eating, because of the smoke. So if you're going out after, bring a change of clothes!

author: Rachel B.
review text:
I grew up in Rancho Cucamonga and remember the rage over Gen when they first opened up. I recently moved to LA and was in town for a wedding on a Friday evening. Friends and I came here for lunch in the middle of the day and expected to be seated rather quickly. It turns out they were understaffed that day as it took us awhile to be seated after the hostess made us feel like an inconvenience with her very dry, no eye contact "welcome".

We could tell the waiter was slammed as he consistently forgot our orders. I would not recommend the onion rings as they tasted as if they were once frozen. Our orders that contained marinated meat took forever to come to the table. Everything else was fine, but I will be visiting the other Korean bbq on the other side of the 15 freeway.

author: George L.
review text:
Lmao this place audio levels scare people with the loud celebrations for bdays but it's very fun nonetheless.

We came here to relax and turns out one of our friends had his bday (didn't know, whoops). The Gen's here is very nice - columns of neon light tableaux are everywhere, the place feels clean, service stood out being great, and the food is the quality one would expect if most Gen's. Personally I would actually rate this Gen's higher than other ones since the service was legitimately great and service was really stood out. Better than other Gens imo.

Our waitress was nice and patient, and we were able to order a bunch of items regularly and timely. I think I counted about 5-6 times we ordered for food in the 2 hours allotted.

Food is good as always, with bulgogi, beef belly, and the more exotic like intestines and such. If you're new and have 3 friends who haven't ordered KBBQ then I recommend getting a little bit of gen chadol (beef brisket ie the round looking slices), anything chicken, samgyubsal (pork belly), and especially bulgogi. They serve with complimentary kimchi, pickles and such and also always ask for rice.

Pretty much standard for all Gens is that they change out the stovetop regularly, so if your stovetop gets charred a person will come by and replace it.

Food is the quality one expects from Gens and honestly the service is solid which is icing on the cake. 5/5.

author: Michelle M.
review text:
After living in Rancho for the last 10 years, and saying that we were going to eat at Gen Korean BBQ House for the last 10 years, we FINALLY did.  
We were going back and forth on what to have for dinner, and decided to try Gen.  I'm so happy that we did.  To be honest though, I'm kind of mad at myself that we wait so long to eat here.  The food is top notch!  Now if you're a newbie to Korean BBQ like us, you're in for a fun time.  You basically order off the all you can eat menu, and cook the food yourself.  There are so many delish items to choose from.  With the recommendations from our server (I can't remember her name), we decided on garlic chicken, Hawaiian steak, short ribs, pork belly, and veggies.  The all you can eat dinner also comes with rice, salad, and an assortment of little side treats like rice paper, kimchi, and pickled cucumbers.  For my fitness minded friends, this is a keto lovers dream restaurant.  Protein, protein, and more protein.  Because I do have a sweet tooth, and enjoy dessert on my cheat days, my only teeny, tiny complaint is they don't have any.  However though, they have a full bar with all of the usual Asian restaurant style drinks, plus everything else.  As for the service...EXCELLENT!  Our drinks were never empty, and we were always checked on to see if we wanted/needed anything else.  
Gen Korean BBQ, you have earned an A+ in my book, and I can't wait to visit again.

author: Adnan K.
review text: I think this is the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Rancho Cucamonga. This place is always very crowded so you have to wait at least 15 / 20 minutes after arrival. This place has a great ambience. Their service is also appreciable. We came here 3 times and each time they served us well. The food is outstanding. It's like all you can eat in two hours. Great food with a variety of meats and other side dishes like calamari, shrimp etc. The meats are very fresh. Salad and rice are also like all you can eat. Even though the price seems a little bit high, this place is recommended for the Korean BBQ lovers.

author: Georgie M.
review text:
GEN Korean BBQ is simply the best BBQ, the best Korean food place to eat in any town they decide to open a restaurant!

I've been reading the mouth watering reviews in Yelp for nearly nine years, going back to their original location in K-town LA.

Ever since we left the east coast, we have been looking for some good Korean food for our Asian blended family. The best so far had been Chodang in Chandler.  yelp.com/biz/chodang-cha…  Recently GEN has opened an outpost in Tempe.

We came here with friends one evening and had a blast.  We didn't have Reservations, so we sat for a bit. But, when we were seated, it was in the middle of the restaurant, with a good view of their prep-kitchen.

Everything was fresh. The service was excellent. Prompted, but never rushed.  The price for dinner was $20 for AYCE (All You Can Eat), which seemed like both a dare and a steal.

Expect to pay around $25 to $30 before taxes and gratuities, depending on how thirsty you are.

Enjoy!

review text:
From all the reviews, it seems like this restaurant is a "hit-or-miss" place.  Gratefully, our experience was a "hit".  Came in on a Sunday afternoon around 12:15pm..got lucky..group of 8, seated immediately.  

Service was quick and diligent.  Male waiter took our orders patiently as everyone was trying to talk at once.  He kept our drinks refilled and changed our grills frequently.  

The condiments were limited and mediocre.  The meats were good with a tad too much seasoning.  The salad was salty but tasty.  There were a wide selection of meats and seafood which was a plus.  My favorite is the kalbi and brisket..shrimp and calamari.

I may come back here but a little skeptical that I'm up for a "miss"next time.

review text: Jinro Chamisul is my fave beverage from S Korea and getting that along with my Gogi-GUI experience was just what I needed. I brought my cousins here because they never experienced Korean BBQ whatsoever and I wanted to make that happen for them. Yelping a Korean BBQ experience near me, Gen was super attractive because of how popular it was and also looked like a promising place to get fresh meats and seafood. Coming in, we were greeted with a hip, dim lighted and cyber looking bar with a table and the stove. We didn't get immediate service to order food, we waited to get the check for what seemed almost an hour. The food, even though we cooked it reasonably well, still tasted sort of salty and off. I was thrown off by the Bulgogi and also spent an hour feeling sick at the restaurant. I wasn't very happy with the service. Overall, I liked the futuristic sit down, but I don't think I will return.

author: Don K.
review text:
What a cool looking restaurant! With the neon accents and tall, tall ceilings in the main room, once you walk in the door, you feel as if something special was going to happen. Or maybe they're trying too hard to make up for something else? This is an all you can eat restaurant, right?

We went on a Saturday afternoon, where only the dinner menu was available, which was ok with us. It's the standard cook it yourself on the table flame cooker. The banchan selection was rather sparse and odd, but we overlooked it because we were there to catch up on a lot of years' worth of stories.

To the menu, which had the classic Korean bbq stuff and other not-so-classics (Cajun shrimp, anyone? Huh???). You are allowed 4 selections at a time and you can double up on a selection, or I'm sure you can get 4 of the same selection at once. The meat selections were well marinated and tasty, except for the pork belly which was NOT marinated. We also ordered the jap chae,  which was just foul. No idea what they used, but it was not the classic ingredients. So, please, please avoid the jap chae!!!

Overall, for a chain, I think the formula works pretty well. Stick with the meats (the calamari steak was ok, but that Cajun shrimp wasn't great - yeah, I just had to try it) and you should be ok.

We walked in around 12:30 pm on a Sunday. There are few people waiting, wearing their masks. The server told us that there is a 25 minute waiting time. They took our name and phone # and maybe around 10-15 minutes of waiting, we already received a text that we can already go for dine in. They also have a temperature scanner before entering the restaurant to make sure the customer doesn't have fever. Food is really good. We got some beef bulgogi and premium chadol. I love the premium chadol and the plain beef bulgogi kind of neautralize the taste. I like the ambiance. All the servers are wearing protective masks and face shield to protect themselves and their customers too which is nice. If you dont want to waste your time waiting in the restaurant or in your car, I believe the yelp has some "Join Waitlist" option so you could reserve your time.

They also will gove you a QR Code so you can access your paperless menu, which is very helpful so as for people to be safe from any viruses or germs.

Overall, nice experience.

review text:
The food and sides are very tasty.  What also makes this place great is that the servers are helpful when and nice about getting you more sides or a particular side dish.  The food was very tasty.  I usually would get the beef brisket and short ribs.

The reason why I give this a 4 star is because, although the food is great, the service was a little worse than usual.  For our first order, we ordered various meats and asked for tofu soup and popcorn chicken.  The two easier items to get out, minus the beef brisket, took almost 15 mins before they came out.  The server said he would check up on it and would only reassure us that they are slowed down a little and would get it out asap.  He had to tell us this twice, before the manager of the restaurant came and took care of it.  Also, for obvious reasons, I think they just gave us less fattier meat so we would eventually get full and leave.  I am always impressed with the first round of meat, but any other rounds of repeating meat and it goes downhill from there.

review text:
I have been wanting to check this place out since it opened, but my guy was like  " why am I going to go to a place where I have to cook my own food?!" I was thinking it sounded fun so I got told let's cook something at home then. lol.
My cousin agreed to come on this food adventure with me and we had a blast. We came for the all you can eat lunch $16.99 a person. We were seated quickly at a booth that had a grilling apparatus in the center. Our server said that our eating experience had a 2 hour time limit. I thought that was funny. We were done in an hour, we don't eat that much !
There were many meats , seafood, soups, and vegetables to pick from.  I enjoyed the whole cooking process. There were different sauces and spices you could choose to add to flavor your meal to your liking.
I am glad I found someone to go with. I want to go again. I am trying to eat lower carbohydrates, so this was a perfect choice.
" I'll be back" ( Terminator voice)

author: Lynn N.
review text: I haven't had Gen for lunch but I have been to other locations for dinner. It was $16.99 for lunch and the food was great. The meats were soft and well seasoned. My favorite was the Hawaiian beef with the pineapple. I would also recommend the short ribs and bulgogi as well. As for the sides, the sweet rice cakes were terrific. The glass noodles was pretty good to okay. The squid was soft as well, not rubbery at all. The shrimps had the heads on with the sweet head butter. The tofu soup was salty and spicy, great for a cold day. The service here was fast once you get their attention. The food also came out quickly after you order. Overall, I would visit this location again.

review text:
Our party came promptly at 8:45pm and checked into our 9pm reservation. We were told it's currently being cleaned. I checked in on our table again at 9:15 and she told me she'd let me know soon and never got back to me. We were finally seated at 9:40pm. I was a little disappointed in the time it took them. It almost defeats the purpose of getting a reservation.

I felt that our server or servers were not super attentive of our table. We had to ask them for silverware for our steamed eggs and the sauces for the meat 4 times because they kept forgetting us. We did not have a consistent server and at times we had flag down people to order more meat

They also made 6 of us share one grill. I've been to other ayce kbbq places where it's usually 4 people per grill. The meats came out pretty slowly and the serving sizes were not meant for 6 people. They were definitely meant for 2-3 people to cook on.

The food was pretty good, and the lack of service starting from the beginning left a bad taste in my mouth.

review text:
Good service and great food!  I've been to quite a few KBBQ places and this place impressed me.  Love the cool look inside, wide and long bench seats, and fun atmosphere.  We came for lunch and our servers were Brandon and Mark.  There were a few mix ups with our meat orders, but nothing that couldn't be fixed.  They were both very friendly and nice and came to check on us.  I was impressed on the cleanliness of the restaurant and the flavors of the food.  Bulgogi and short ribs are theeee best!!!  I also liked the dessert macaroon.

Would go back again if we are in town!

review text:
Saddest experience ever at this location. We eat kbbq usually about 2x a month. We hardly ever come to this location(usually we go to Chino Hills). Anyways we checked in around 7:40pm waited about 40 mins to be seated. Once we get to our table there are no utensils no sauces, just plates. So it takes about 15 mins for our server to take our order.
Our 1 plate of bulgogi and shrimp come out and that's it. For 4 people... we wait about 30 more mins to order more food and our utensils drinks etc, about 1 hr later we're missing a ton of stuff not to mention all the tables in our section are all dirty. mind you we only ate 1 plate of bulgogi, 1 plate of shrimp and a plate of brisket. We were so done already, not wanting to wait any longer so we get the bill and it's almost $100.00. Smh

Ste A

author: Maryanne D.
review text:
My favorite Gen!

This is our family's go-to Gen KBBQ House. We've been to several of their other locations but this location is always consistent when it comes to the quality of food and customer service. On our recent visit, Gene as our server and he was awesome! Very friendly and funny guy. He was super attentive throughout our meal. He kept our meat orders comin', our grill was changed out every time as it was needed, and our waters were always filled up. Every time we've dined here, we always received the same great service and attention. They truly have a great staff here. I wish I could say the same for the Chino Hills location, which is much closer to us but due to the inconsistency of their customer service there, we make the drive to Rancho and it is always worth it.

Hubs and I love the beef brisket, beef belly, garlic pork belly, bulgogi, and cajun shrimp. Yummm! Everything, including the salad and unlimited banchan, is always fresh and tasty. Even the restrooms were very clean and well-stocked!

We also had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Adam. Super nice young man who genuinely care about the satisfaction of his customers. We often see him walking around, visiting other guests and ensuring everyone leaves with a pleasant, fun and delicious experience.

5 stars for the food, 5 stars for the service. Happy bellies all around. Keep it up, Rancho Gen!

review text: I've been here a few times. And I kind of started migrating to U-grill instead. But lately I've started coming back here because I felt that Gen had more variety of meats. Like pork cheek, my fave! Also, the best part is, they open at 10am on the weekends. So that's a plus! I am a morning person, so a girl get hannnggry by 9am haha. I feel like it's the best time to come, you beat the rush and your food come out super quick!

Ste A

author: Cindy Z.
review text:
Gen BBQ is the high fashion of Korean BBQ. The better the quality, the higher the price as well though. For $25 AYCE dinner, it's worth the value on the special occasion though. I came out here with a party of 16 for a friend's going away dinner. There was a huge mishap and situation with them holding a table for us even after we put down a $200 deposit. It was ridiculous, but luckily we got it figured out eventually. The couple who took the awkward table between our group even opted to move to another table so our group wouldn't be separated. Nonetheless, it was all figured out and our entire group had arrived.

To get to the point, the food here is great. My favorites are the angus beef and hawaiian beef. --both are absolute musts. Here's a warning: DO NOT get the steamed egg because they come raw and you must waste space on your grill to cook it. I mean, unless you have that kind of patience and love steamed egg enough to do so, be my guest.

I do have to give it to them for good service despite us being a huge group and asking for many refills. Props to Hannah for constantly checking up on us!

author: Trina D.
review text:
My parents and I had dinner here since it's literally the only KBBQ AYCE joint in town.  I was excited about their opening last year but this was the first time I'd been since then.  My parents have gone several times and seem to like the place.  It is a typical Gen KBBQ with fancy booths, a club-like atmosphere, and menu.  Our first server basically took our drink order, food order and left.  He wasn't seen again until we needed a grill change and when it was time to pay.  Our second server, Mirayla (?), was amazing.  She made sure our requests were put in timely, and checked on us when there was a lull.  We made sure she got the tip despite the other server coming by to see if we had paid the bill.  She worked her ass off and my parents were impressed.  Somebody give the girl a raise.  

Food was good for Gen and we ordered a variety of items: sirloin steak, bulgogi, chadol, Cajun prawns, calamari, Hawaiian steak, japchae, vegetables, soondooboo, and short ribs (boneless and with bones).  The meal was great and despite the hiccup with the first server, we had a pleasant time.  They have an upstairs area too with seats as well so it's a fairly large restaurant.  They have a full bar as well.  Sadly dessert is not included but you can purchase separately if you're in the mood.  $14.99 for lunch weekdays, $19.99 for dinner and all-day weekends.

We started off with the the Hawaiian Steak, Cajun shrimp, beef bulgogi and teriyaki chicken. We all fell in love with the Hawaiin steak so we kept that meat in our rotation all night!! The other things we tried was the Cajun chicken (barf), tongue (ehhh), and the rib. At this point I was too stuffed to keep eating so I didn't try the rib but my buddy thought it was good.

Worst experience ever!

First we arrived Thursday evening at 7:15 and the entry way was jam packed full of people. I go up, and put my name on the list. The wait time was 45 minutes. Just 15 minutes shy of my "fuck this" time. But the place seemed like it was poppin.

Our first order still didn't arrive for 10 minutes... it's raw meat, so what's the hold up? Not like they had to butcher the pigs and cows out back.

We had two different servers the whole time. Every time we ordered they would screw it up. We ordered 2 plates of brisket, they would bring 1 plate. We ordered a round of rice THREE TIMES and they never came. Everything we asked for, never came. We were seated for TWO HOURS and only had food delivered THREE TIMES. We literally left hangry, and pissed. We were seriously so hungry on our last hour there, we were licking our small banchan bowls clean. And those are complimentary AKA FREE. Top it off we ran out of banchan in our first 15 minutes there - they never bothered giving us more. We also ran out of drinks within 30 minutes, they never bothered to get us refills. Mango soju was good. The spicy rice cakes were alright. And the cucumber kimchi was really good.

Ventilation was AWFUL. Smoke in our faces, and they only changed our grill ONCE. And the tables are so close together that other peoples smoke was flying in our direction.

Overall, horrible experience. Service was nonexistent. Two adults, one kid cost $79.35... we left $80 and bounced. Sorry, if the service wasn't to our liking, you aren't getting a good tip... just a fuck you tip.

author: Rachel S.
review text:
As people know, my 4 &  5 star reviews are reserved for places that I'm a fan of & genuinely believe are "as good as it gets." You won't see me doling out top marks for places with forgettable or adequate fare.

This location had the best Korean BBQ I've ever had. It was so good in fact, that I was texting pricing info and pics to family for their next trip to CA, before we were even done with the meal.

Went here right after it opened for the day on  6/25/15. Upon entering, it looks like you're stepping into a night club. It was cool!

After eating at various establishments, I have a grill preference. It's annoying when you constantly have to change grill tops & have to wait for them to preheat because they char and smoke. During our meal, we only changed tops once. The grills are solid metal & slightly dome shaped with holes around the circumference to drain the grease. No unsightly grease pooling in a tray that has to be changed multiple times during the meal here.

The portions here are very generous. I'd almost suggest ordering a partial portion of new meats that you're trying so you're not left either stuffed or with leftovers that you can't take home.

I honestly have no idea how this place turns a profit because the meat quality is great and weekday lunch is $15 pp. The sirloin steak was insane - thick, with a wonderful fat "rind." The bulgogi was the best I've ever had. I'd say skip all the poultry if you even remotely enjoy beef - it's that good.

I like that the banchan was served in tiny portions so that you could fill up on meat. While some places serve endless appetizers to get you full on cheap carbs, Gen does not. They do have japchae as an option but there's nothing special about it. Again, it's all about the meat.

As a final flourish to an incredible meal, macaron ice cream sandwiches are sold separately for $3.25 near the register. Try one.

Service is fantastic. The place is clean. The servers are attentive without breathing down your neck trying to turn or cut your meat or messing with your burner (aka like most kbbq places.)  I can't wait to go back!

My fiance and I were starbing and pulled into the new Golden Corral in San Bernardino. After hearing many good things, we decided that today was the day to check it out..but then we pulled into the parking lot and saw the line of people waiting outside. Figuring out that it would take at least 20 minutes to actually get into the restaurant, we then decided to drive 20 minutes to Gen, a Korean BBQ place that we wanted to try.

We were quickly seated and greeted by a staff member who explained that on weekends, the dinner menu is available to order from. She also explained that there were unlimited rounds with a maximum of 4 orders each. This was also accompanied with salad and unlimited bonchon (i.e. kimchee, potato salad, cucumber kimchee, pickled garlic). We proceeded to order Hawaiian steak, beef brisket, pork belly, shrimp, beef belly, and calamari (separate orders). The best items were definitely the flavorful, juicy, tender kalbi and the thinly sliced, melt-in-your-mouth beef brisket. These are the best items to order! Do not waste money on the seafood because it was only average. We will definitely be back!

review text:
I took my children here last night. When I dine out I look for a clean restaurant with great ambiance and excellent food. Gen in Rancho has a great ambiance. Low lighting. A fun, younger/youngish crowd and it appeared pretty clean. The wait was about 30 min on a Thursday night (we were quoted a 25-35 min wait). While waiting I went to use the restroom. The women's restroom only had 2 stalls so a line began to form.

The waiting area is small. Yes, we're in SoCal, but it was cool outside and I wasn't fond of sitting on top of other patrons.

Once we were finally seated, we were offered drinks. We were told two waiters would be serving us. Shortly after, a larger party was seated next to us. Their drinks and meats came quickly, much more quickly before ours did. I thought It was a fluke at first but it kept happening. To add insult to injury, some of of the "marinated" meats were bland. Although the waiters knew my party hadn't eaten there before, they didn't bother helping us with the cooking aspect of the meat. I had to peek at other tables.

I finally asked for the manager and after 15 minutes she came. I let her know that I traveled 40 mins to eat there when I have places closer to my home because my friend gave Gen a good recommendation. She empathized with me, comped 2 of the 3 meals and I left hungry. Never again will I visit Gen in Rancho. The manager was wonderful but I shouldn't have to complain when eating out. They should know better.

author: Charlene C.
review text:
Since my parents babysat two of our dogs on New Year's Eve, my husband and I took them here for lunch on January 2nd. We got there right at 11:00AM when they open. Originally the hostess told us it would be a 10 minute wait for a table, but they sat us within a few minutes.

The price was $14.99 per person during lunch (weekdays) which is really good! I'm used to going to other AYCE KBBQ places that usually charge around $20/person for lunch. (It's $19.99 for dinner and during weekends.) As others have mention, they totally have the "club" feel inside and were playing great music. My mom recognized one of the songs, "oh this is from The Hunger Games: Mocking Jay" soundtrack." LOL.

After we sat down, our server Raymond introduced himself to us. We all got the spicy tofu soup to start. You can only put in 4 orders of meat per round. We tried the Beef Bulgogi, Hawaiian Steak, Chadol, Miso Samgyubsal, Soondooboo, Calamari Steak, Shrimp, Gobchang, Jap Chae, and Nook Gan Sal.

My favorite so far is the Hawaiian Steak. My dad got the small pig intestine and he was the only one who liked it.. HAHA. It's just too chewy for the rest of us.

During our meal, we were helped by 4 different servers! One even helped cut up the meat for us and gave us tips on the best way to cook each meat. Wow, I must say... they are really on their game! They were constantly taking away used plates, refilling our hot teas, changing out our grill, and checking up on us. There are staff here from the Torrance restaurant helping out since they just barely opened. The manager also stopped by our table and he said he was the manager at the Torrance one as well.

On the way out, we tried two of their Brick Macaron Ice Cream Sandwiches (cappuccino and strawberry). They are $3.25 each.

We are so glad we finally have a Korean BBQ in Rancho Cucamonga. We will definitely be back again..... and again....  :)

2/100 Reviews for 2015

review text:
This restaurant was huge which meant a lot of seatings and the wait isn't too bad. My friends and I came here for a birthday and we were seated instantly (probably because it was only a party of 4). Our hostess was extremely attentive and made some good recommendations on how to cook the intestines if we were going to order them.

At our table were side dishes & a huge bowl of house salad. Our waitress, Loren was super friendly and was constantly asking us if we needed any refills or anymore orders. For our first round, we ordered: spicy pork bulgogi, spicy pork belly, large intestines, & beef bulgogi. The food came out quickly & it didn't take long before we demolish all of our meat! My personal favorite was the spicy beef bulgogi & the spicy pork belly for round 1. While the intestine were crispy, it wasn't much of anything to me and it took a bit too long to cook. The beef bulgogi was also good, however, I did not enjoy the sweetness to it as much. I mean it was still pretty bomb!

For our second round, we ordered: garlic pork belly, regular pork belly, kalbi short ribs, chicken bulgogi, & some glass noodles w/ vegetables. Once again, all the meats were delicious. I liked the original pork belly a lot better than the garlic pork belly. However, my housemates seem to enjoyed the garlic pork belly a lot more. It all comes down to reference! I like my pork belly cooked w/ a sprinkle of salt, that's why I prefer the original one. However, I do like the spicy pork belly more than the original. But like I said, it's really your personal preference! The glass noodles was a bit TOO chewy for my liking.  

For our third and last round, we had more spicy pork bulgogi, pork belly, spicy rice cakes, & this time we tried the small intestines. I wasn't a fan of the small intestines since it had a bitter taste to it and it was super chewy. I really like the spicy rice cakes since it was all fried and chewy but I could use it without the sauce.

Since it was my friends birthday, the waiters/waitress came to sing her a song & gave her some pineapples while they held up a match so she can blow it out. It was awesome, ghetto, & hilarious @ the same time!

Overall I would give this place a 4/5 stars because the food was delicious & the service was friendly! However, the portions of the meat were little & only fed up to 2 people. So if you had a party of 2+ you would have to order double & it is only recommended that you order 4 dishes per round! Also, it was only $19.99 per person for dinner & they had such a large meau compare to other AYCE Korean BBQ, it was def worth it!

I would definitely come back next time ;)

address:

author: Wendy L.
review text:
After a year and a couple visits, I've waited to review Gen Korean BBQ House. Gen has several locations in Southern California and offers a good selection of meats to grill at your table.

LOCATION / PARKING
You'll find this Gen on Foothill Blvd, just west of Victoria Gardens. It shares the same lot as Wabi Sabi Steak House & Sushi Bar. It's always hard to find parking in the area so prepare to easily find a spot further from the restaurant.

WAIT TIME
My first visit here was for a birthday so we had a good amount of tables reserved for us on the upper level with zero wait time! We literally walked in and told them we had reservations, and we walked right up to our reserved area---and our entire party wasn't there yet! Second visit was a little longer for myself and one other person. Third visit was no more than 15 minutes! All times I've visited were during dinner hours.

AMBIENCE / ATMOSPHERE
If you're looking for a loud, club-like feel for dinner, then Gen KBBQ will deliver! The bright neon lights make for a fun and lively atmosphere on the main, lower level. While still loud, the upper level seating provides less lighting--although you still see some of the lights coming through from below. This is not the place for a quiet evening!

FOOD / PRICE
For the quality of food offered, the price is great. Some meats come out plain while some are marinated. My favorite are the spicy ones. Also, this is a place where you'll have to cook your own food. You choose which meats you like (about 3-4 items at a time) and a server will bring them out to you (raw) to cook on the grill. They will not cook it for you so, if you don't feel like grilling your own meal, Gen may not be where you want to go.

CUSTOMER SERVICE
We had excellent service on our first visit at the upper level. Someone kept changing out our grill, refilling our drinks, and asking if we needed anything else. My second visit here was horrible. We had seats in the lower corner and our orders were mixed up with 3 other tables! So the table next to us got our orders while we got the orders placed by the other table next to us. It was a mess between the 4 tables. When I came with a group of friends on my third visit and ended up sitting in the same lower corner, I was a bit apprehensive due to the prior visit. Fortunately, it actually was quite the opposite! The only thing I don't like about Gen is how the suited guys wearing the 2-way earpieces were rather boorish to the servers. I know they're there to help keep guests eating within a time frame (2 hours) but it's obvious their sense of authority goes a bit overboard. We witnessed one guy talking down to one of the servers like some jerk. So rude! I don't like seeing that while having dinner. Perhaps go to the back (away from customers) and talk to the server politely? Just a suggestion.

STROLLERS / WALKERS / WHEELCHAIRS
Personally, I wouldn't want to take young children or babies near KBBQ restaurants for safety measures. However, as far as space is concerned, they do have spacious aisles to move around for all strollers, walkers, and wheelchairs. I'm not sure there is elevator access to the upper level, however, as I only recall taking stairs to get up there.

Pros:
- Iced Green Tea is delicious!
- Price
- Food
- Modern, club-like atmosphere
- Spacious
- Upper level seating
- Grills are changed out often
- Ice Cream Macarons!!

Cons:
- Grill your own food
- You will smell like KBBQ (clothes, hair, skin!)
- Suited guys wearing ear-pieces
- Access to upper level
- Loud
- Parking
- Wait time
- Not for quick-dining

There are a few things to consider but, overall, Gen KBBQ's food ranks more superior than their inadequacy.

author: David G.
review text:
Oh Eric. Eric Eric Eric. It seems like anything in life that's too good to be true (like AYCE KBBQ for instance) has to come with a rotten egg. I'd been coming to this Gen since it opened a year ago, but the lousy service we received yesterday from you at the bar will make me think twice about coming back. Lesson learned: don't settle for bar seating.

Let me start out with the positives. I like Gen. I've been a regular for many years and have been to multiple locations, from Cerritos to Pasadena to the new one that opened up in Torrance recently. If you look at the glowing reviews for all of these locations, they usually share at least 4 stars or higher on Yelp. Why is that? It's easy: Gen has established a reputation for itself for delivering amazing KBBQ. I'd be kidding myself though if I gave credit solely to the food. It's the SERVICE that will make or break any experience, regardless of how good the food tastes. And quite frankly Eric, your service made the whole experience tasteless.

- For starters, we couldn't barbecue our food. Initially we just awkwardly stared for 5 minutes at the flaccid beef brisket you gave us as it lay motionless on the grill, waiting for it to sizzle. It never did. The grill you gave us didn't allow enough air circulation and suffocated whatever flame that was trying to spark. After hailing you several times, you finally changed the grill without an apology. Thanks. This is getting off to a great start.

- It took forever to get any service. Whereas the parties surrounding us were getting prompt grill changes and having their water refilled on the dot, your lack of service made us believe we were no where to be seen. We actually had to hail other waiters to get our meal moving along. Would it have been too much to ask for to replace our charcoal-stained grill? Oh wait, no, that would involve being proactive.

- Where was the check? We talked to another waiter serving us if we could have the bill, who then gestured to you while you were taking a sip of water at the bar to come over. I understand not to mistake neglect for being busy when it comes to waitering, but honestly it didn't seem like you were attending to anyone at that moment. And if you were, you didn't tell us--no apologizes, no explanation. Just the bill, 10 minutes later after the fact.

It's unfortunate this happened, because I honestly liked going here up until yesterday. It's not the end of the world though, my girlfriend and I will probably just go to another Gen that delivers the same respectful and amazing service that's been consistent with all the previous experiences I've had throughout the years. It won't be at this location though.

THE BAD
I had to wait 10 minutes for a one person table. And thats not even a complaint. I just could not find anything bad.

THE FANTASTIC.
The amount of options to pick is over 30. All you can sample for 19.99 for dinner. That is crazy. I made half orders so I could try more stuff. I think I did half the menu. Nothing was bad. It was better and best.

The icing on the cake was the wait staff. It was some of the best service I have had in any restaurant. Between suggestions, to grill changes, to how fast they got the proteins out to me was awesome. Trina and her tag team partner paulo!

ETC
if you want quiet you will not be happy. Loud music rocking out with a very fun vibe. Just loud enough it's perfect first date stuff. If I am ever back in the area I will come again for sure!

address:

Ste A

author: Bernardo M.
review text:
Let me start by saying that the food here is amazing! The tri-tip and the brisket are out of this world good! We never walk out of here disappointed...we do walk out about two, maybe three pounds heavier though. Gen has a very sophisticated ambience in my opinion. Its definitely one of the nicer Korean BBQ restaurants that I've been to. We always ask to be seated in Steve's section. He's very down to earth and is always on top of his tables.

Now the reasons for the 4 star rating instead of 5: we've been here a handful of times and sometimes run into bad service. I understand that this place gets crowded, and the servers get slammed, but on occasion we'll be waiting several minutes for someone to take our order or even change up our grill.

Second, they treat their dipping sauces like gold here. My gf and I are constant dippers. We dip like its our last day on earth. We always have to ask several times for them to refill our trays, and every single time they fill it with the same small amount. But eh, that's no biggie.
Lastly, it seems like everyone in town comes here for their birthday. The servers have a way of singing happy birthday that I actually think is quite funny. They don't just sing it to you, they straight yell in your face. BUT, last night they did that eight times...and of course all of those tables were right around us, that's a lot of screaming. I know I can't blame the staff for this one, its not their fault that everyone wants to come here on their birthday.

I was there with my gf and thought it would be funny to tell the staff that it was her birthday too. She was so annoyed with all the singing/yelling that I just had to do it. Boy did that backfire on me! Thankfully all of our dogs our indoor dogs, because if they were outdoor dogs and had dog houses I would of definitely been sleeping in one of them last night.

Gen, you guys are awesome and we love your food! I'm taking my parents this weekend, so be prepared to sing for my mom...even though her birthday is in December.

author: Kathleene E.
review text:
This is the 2nd Gen I've visited - the first one being in Alhambra. We were in town the same weekend as Hard Summer and wanted to get our KBBQ So.Cal style fix before we headed back to the Bay. We were super close to this location, and the reviews were great so we figured why not! It was also a plus that they opened at 11am for lunch.

The location itself is within a plaza with very spacious parking. We got there around 1055am and there were literally 3-5 parties waiting to go inside. I had an inkling that they went to the music festival too B) We were seated immediately and we could see they were going to be very busy very quickly, and that they were. Phung, our server was very well-mannered at tried his best to serve us as quickly as possible. The boyfriend and I saw that he was slammed with more than 5 parties in his area so we're not knocking down any starts due to the (slow, but not as fast as it could've been) customer service.

The lunch price CANNOT be beat - $15.00 for AYCE KBBQ! My favorites were the beef bulgogi, short ribs, pineapple steak, angus beef, calamari and shrimp! Among the banchan, all the kimchi dishes were delish but my favorite was the mashed potatoes. Also, don't forget to order the seasonings on the side to give your meal a little bit more pizzazz (you'll see they're listed on the very bottom of the menu upon request only)

They changed the grill pretty often and the ventilation was very good, we didn't reek too much of KBBQ (which is to be expected when you dine at places like this). By the time we were finished with our meal (12:30 pm) the house was already packed and the wait was RIDICULOUS!

My tips - go here early, and expect a wait if you come in an hour or so after opening time.
Don't go for the macaroon ice cream sandwich ($3.50) - it's overpriced for this dinky little ice cream thing that's pretty flavorless. Other than that, everything was great. I definitely will be back!

review text:
I have been to GEN for nearly 20 times. I started to go there since its opening. Once I went to GEN three times in a week. Haha

waiting: GEN takes reservation for party one day in prior. Usually in weekdays, the waiting is about 5-10 minutes. But in weekend, the waiting is like longer than 40 minutes. Anyway, it's worthy to wait.

Price: the menu is affordable. For lunch on weekday is 15.99?? Dinner and weekends are 19.99.

Appetizers: they provides a variety of Korean appetizers for free. The kimchi is excellent. For me, the potatoes and salad are my favorite. They have special sauce for salad, which makes it tastes good.
 
Food : I have been to gen many times that I don't even need a menu. People usually order prime steak, the beef slice, beef tongue and beef brisket.  I always order pork cheek, regular pork belly, popcorn chicken and tofu soup. Usually I will warp the meat with the rice paper. I enjoy eating both meat and rice paper together.  The tofu in the tofu soup is soft, Although a little bit spicy.

Desert. They have macaron. Usually I can't eat macaron cuz I'm full:)

Service. The restaurant hires young adult, which makes their staffs energetic. In special occasions like birthday party, they will sing you a song. (They are sooooooooo loud that everyone in the restaurant will know that it's your birthday.)

Anyway, for health concern, eat more salad when you are eating meat. After the meal, people will usually smell like Korean bbq.

review text:
I have been to the Gen in Tustin. I was excited to see that this location is significantly bigger and more accommodating.

The environment is really cool. Spacious seating. Booths and bar style seating. You're able to cook your own food which is super fun for friends or going on a date.

Unfortunately the dish they were out of is my absolute favorite (Hawaiian steak). We had the brisket, Cajun shrimp, garlic chicken, top sirloin and the veggie plate.

We had two glasses of Chardonnay. One was delivered really get with our food the other took some time.

I love the food and the environment that's why I keep coming back. Perhaps it was the luck of the draw and the service will be better next time. Overall satisfaction gets 4 stars. The first server we had was fabulous and when our second server came back from his break it was a feeling of wanting to close and we were an inconvenience. (They close at 11:30 and we were there till 10:45)

I would completely recommend Gen to anyone. Servers change but the food, vibe, and drinks are constant! Total win in my book to go back!

review text:
Hands down, this has to be some of the BEST Korean BBQ I've ever had. Came on a Saturday evening with a 1 1/2 hour wait.  I normally don't have the patience to wait this long to sit at a restaurant but I'd been craving KBBQ all day and if we had to wait 1 1/2 hours, then we had to wait 1 1/2 hours.  It ended up being an hour wait by the time we were seated.

AYCE is $20 per person and there is quite a bit of selection when it comes to meats. Honestly, I can't really remember the specific meats we had as it's been a few weeks since I've eaten there.  I remember everything being delicious.

Once you're seated at your table, your side dishes are waiting for you, and each person is given their own side dishes (4-5) so you don't have to share.  I remember the mashed potatoes.  I want more of those mashed potatoes.  They were sweet, with little bits of corn & carrots.  

Hands down, food is easily 5 stars for this place, but I'm knocking a star down because of service.  Our server was really nice, but they just seemed to be understaffed when we went.  It took awhile to receive our drinks.  We got our 1st round of meats before we even received our drinks.  Rice here doesn't seem to be a given.  We had to ask for that, and that even took awhile to get.  We asked for more radish and rice paper. That never came.

I've heard great things about this chain as I know they have locations throughout the SoCal region. This is a newer location which just opened in December, so I was super excited to try it out.

The interior is definitely very hip; you can just imagine a nice club but kbbq grills everywhere.  The restaurant space is huge with dual level dining; my party of 4 was seated in the upper area for lunch.  

I want to first say, I had 2 great waiters, Brandon and Josh.  They were absolutely amazing and were very knowledgeable about all the different meats and service was very on par! The lunch price is $14.99 for an advertised 30+ items (keep a note that includes extra side dishes).  

The meat was very fresh, and I enjoyed the wide selection of marinated meats but some that really stood out for me were the following: Hawaiian steak, Beef Bulgolgi, Garlic Chicken, and Boneless Pork Ribs.  They also have Jap Chae noodles which is one of my favorite dishes, so I really appreciated that.  

I would definitely come back to Gen! If you guys are coming here request Brandon and Josh (if the manager is reading this, please pass along my name and comment to them!).

address:

author: Ruel G.
review text:
Finally ... delicious Korean BBQ in Rancho Cucamonga! After Seafood City (Filipino supermarket) opened over a year ago and Star Crab (Boiling Crab knockoff) began serving a few months ago, my wife and I were wondering when a decent KBBQ joint would show up in town. We love all of the Asian eateries in the San Gabriel Valley, but we don't always feel like making the half-hour drive. When we learned that GEN was opening after Christmas in our neck of the woods, we were excited, to say the least.

GEN went beyond our expectations in every aspect: food, service, value, and atmosphere. We began the new year with family visiting from out of town and took them here for lunch. Every person in our party was impressed with the restaurant's decor: it's hip and trendy, words that aren't usually associated with Rancho Cucamonga. It has a club-like feel to it, with good music in the background.

For our initial visit, service was close to overbearing: it seemed like every few minutes a server was checking on us and it felt like we were barely finishing a mouthful of food before somebody was asking if we needed anything else. The servers were friendly and helpful, though, so I chalked it up to a new crew still finding its legs. I'd rather have too-eager-to-please servers, though, than ones who drop off your food and disappear until it's time to pay the bill.

That being said, the service for dinner the next night (yes, we enjoyed it so much, we went on consecutive days) was more in line with what I expected. Again, our servers were helpful and attentive, but didn't hover during our meal. Since this is a new restaurant in the area, I appreciated how helpful the staff was; even though I came here with KBBQ veterans, the servers clearly explained all of the dishes and offered good recommendations. They were quick to change out our grills and refill our drinks.

During both of our meals, we liked all of the meats we tried: pork belly, premium chadol (ribeye), prime sirloin, spicy pork bulgogi, galbi, garlic pork belly, garlic chicken, cajun shrimp, and the hawaiian steak. My favorites so far are the galbi, pork belly, and prime sirloin, and I also enjoyed the jap chae (glass noodles with veggies). All of the banchan were good, if not spectacular. The meat was definitely the star of the show, as it should be when you're happily grilling away. For $20 all-you-can-eat, this is a superb value and there are a lot of choices (by my count, 31 different meats; there are also some veggies, soups, and noodles available). You order four meats at a time and the portions are generous and served quickly. You won't leave hungry, but if possible, save a little room for one of their tasty macaron ice cream sandwiches.

Overall, a superb addition to the growing number of Asian restaurants in the area. Highly recommended.

They just slipped it to us! I can't imagine what the current dinner service is like.

Yes, I'm still excited for this place and we will come back...but not any time soon. The food is great, the price is fair, and the staff/servers are friendly. Hopefully, 6-8 months from now when the rush dies down and they get their routine on lock, our next experience can be a lot smoother.

I look forward to when I can update this review.

I'm going to say my first ever experience was HORRIBLE, bad service, bad management! I came in with my wife, a friend and his girlfriend. We were seated and waited a LONG time 20+ minutes until we decided that we likely were forgotten about entirely. So I approached a random guy, told him if he could help us which then explained he wasn't our waiter but he would find the person to service us, after a few minutes a gentleman comes by and sincerely apologizes and says that he didn't know he was covering our table and that there was miscommunication on their side. i said no worries, not a problem (thinking things would sail smoothly from there). He asked for the drinks we desired, put them into his ipad, then took our food order which also went into his ipad. He also mentioned due to delay, the sodas were on the house (made me feel good that he sincerely apologized and also threw in the drinks) -- only right thing to do right?

I also thought the ordering process with advanced technology was neat, first ever KBBQ i seen take orders like that.

Problem is, our drinks never came... And we asked for three sides of rice and only received two and brought it to one of the waiters attention which then promised to bring it (never did) so my friend and his girlfriend decided to share theirs.

We get the food, we're starving and ready to eat and we start cooking. The grill just isn't hot enough, so i inquired and he said keep the food off the holes and we'll be good (I told him oh, ok) my bad! But after doing so, I realized this didn't do much. I was disappointed with how slow things were to cook, but i moved on and tried to keep going. (I also read later via yelp reviews for this location that it's a known issue as well)

Anyhow, fast forward we begin eating after some time of the food cooking and I enjoy the taste of the food, no disappointment in taste, but WHERE'S OUR DRINKS? I flag the manager tell him, and he asked what we'd like and that he'd bring them. He never brought them :( Another guy eventually came and asked if we got our drinks, i said no the manager is bringing them. The waiter that inquired said that he'd be taking the order (our third time giving our drink order now) and he luckily followed through and brought them. I assume the first waiter obviously forgot, the manager then grabbed our order but likely forgot what we wanted so sent the third person to inquire and fulfill our drink request. Just wow....

Throughout our stay, the lack of service, and changing of grills was disappointing. I had to inquire many things from the manager such as changing the grill etc as well as ordering more food due to lack of proper service.

Fast forward some more, we eventually decided it'd be time to depart so we asked for the check, got it 15 minutes later and instantly provided the credit card and told them to ring us out (no reductions in price aside from the drinks for all the disappointment).... We waited another 20 minutes to get the credit card back and check so we could tip and leave. I still decided to tip $10 when in reality the entire meal for all four should of been on the house, and no tip was necessary.

NOTE: On my first visit, i noticed their spicy tofu soup was inconsistent, one was edible while the other was not (very oily and spicy, and heavily concentrated) you can see the pics attached to the reviews to see the difference....

FAST FORWARD to my second visit (today), we arrive and wait ~15 minutes and then are seated and quite instantly are asked about what drinks we want and if we've been there before and if we're ready to order. I said yes :) Service was better this time, food was just as good as my first visit. So I see some positive things which will allow me an opportunity to try it for the third time.

Overall I am giving them three stars, and i hope i can up the rating during my future visits. From my current experience, all I can say is BAD SERVICE, TASTY GOOD. I hope my future experiences outweigh the first one enough for me to forget about it :P

author: Darren H.
review text:
FINALLY a Korean BBQ restaurant in the IE and thankfully it was Gen! I have been a fan of it for a while now, but making the trek to the Tustin location was more of a chore because it was always so busy and alas the time for Gen to unload on the IE has arrived and unload it has!

We did attempt to make reservations, but the main number seemed to get directed to a fax number which seemed odd, but their sister location in Cerritos was the same way so maybe there's a coincidence there. Regardless the wait was minimal to get a table and that was even on a busy Saturday night too..It did seem like amongst the traffic they do shuffle in and out people at a very efficient pace..We waited at most 15 minutes or so and the hostess actually held the booth for us which I thought was a rarity given the influx of diners.

Compared to the Tustin location the Rancho location is quite immense and certainly can house quite a bit of BBQ connoisseurs..I hate to mention it, but yes the decor does resemble a night club and has a futuristic appeal to it..It reminded me of eating with Aliens or even dining with the 3 breasted woman in total recall (ok that was a bit much, but just know the decor was something out of the norm and it worked)..=OP

Food wise, the quality of the meat (especially being AYCE) is one of the better compared to many of the OC establishments I have tried..The best part of it was that you cook it yourself so if it comes out short of your liking you can only blame yourself and not that of Gen!

Some standouts of the meal are the Gen Bulgogi, Hawaiian Steak, Bistro Harami (Marinated Spicy Pork), and Jap Chae (Glass Noodles)..Certainly must haves by any means and at $19.95 per person your wallet and tummy will think you're the bees knees once the smoke clears!

The only mixed feeling was the service as it honestly was hit or miss..It seemed some of the waiters looked like chickens with no head running around and most of the "lackeys" are the ones who saved the meal..They were accommodating and very apologetic in the times of error (i.e. drinks empty, cooking utensils forgotten, and an order of Spicy Pork not put in with the kitchen)..With the hustle and bustle of Gen it's hard to not have a soft spot for that stuff..Did it kill the meal? No. Is it going to prevent me from coming back? No. Can you sense that they were genuinely sorry? Yes.

All in all, job well done Gen and welcome finally to the IE..May you spread your wings and fly meaty goodness to one and all!

review text:
MEH. Gen KBBQ House is like a pretty girl with no personality...nice to look at, amazing to be in, but when it comes down to it not worth your time.

Came with some of my coworkers on a weekday night for dinner. $20 for AYCE, pretty standard. The wait wasn't too terrible but sheeeesh standing outside in the cold was a bitch! When we finally got called I had such high expectations for this place, I loved the decor. It has a lounge/clubby vibe to it. But I didn't come here for the ambiance, so on to the food.

FOOD: First of all, our waiter told us that some of the meats on the menu weren't available because they had run out. I almost laughed! This is an AYCE place, and on a weeknight. None of the KBBQ restaurants I've frequented have ever told us they were out of anything. With that being said, we ordered some of the meats (you're allowed to choose 4 at a time, also standard for any KBBQ place) and waited. WOWWW was all I thought when they started dropping off our food. There were 4 of us at the table (and one of my friend's daughters), and the amount of meat they give you is ridiculously small. If there are 4 adults at a table why don't you accommodate that amount in the food you bring us? We ran out in like 10 minutes. I mean shit, I'm no pig (most of the time) but ya girl was hungry! I guess they were scared of running out of more meat so they underfed us. Don't get me wrong the meats were good (maybe 'cus I was a little faded but who knows), but it didn't make up for the amount we were gipped of. The sides they gave were scarce as well. Kimchi was okay, which was sad because that's my favorite thing everrr.

SERVICE: Again, nothing special, extremely sub-par. Our waiter was cool but he messed up our drink order twice, and we had to flag down another waiter because he was MIA. Took forever for them to check on us & get our next order, forgot to bring more of whatever sides we asked for, etc. And it wasn't like we were mean or rude either, all of us are waitresses so we were super nice.

OVERALL: This place is OKAY. 1 star for the ambiance, 1 star for the food, and 1 more star because of the okay service. Come if you wanna impress a girl who's never been here/had KBBQ before & you're trying to get it in. Would I come back? Maybe if someone offered to pay for my meal. Otherwise I'll make the trip to Rowland Heights or K-Town for my KBBQ fix.

Asked for two orders of galbi (you can order up to 4 plates at a time) and received two small pieces that look like someone just threw it on a plate from 10 ft away... lucky shot. See pic. Got radish paper and waitress knocked over a glass of water onto it. Didn't clean up the water on the table and didn't bring more radish paper. See pic. I think they didn't change the grill often because they were trying to smoke us out. Servers more concentrated on singing happy birthday than actually serving. author: Paul R.
review text: Wonderful, wonderful place! The cuts of meat and the seasonings/marinades are phenomenal. The seafood is awesome - we had the spicy garlic shrimp and spicy calamari. The pork small intestines were earthy and very delicious - we cooked them until they were nice and crispy. The pork belly choices and pork cheek were all amazing as well as the beef belly. Hard to pick a favorite. For $19.99 all you can eat for dinner - you really get your money's worth. All the accompaniments were good as well - the miso garlic sauce, sesame oil dressing, seaweed seasoning, kimchee, rice wrappers, and spicy chili paste. Words cannot express how happy my buddy and I were. The service was incredible. I never once had to ask for a thing and our server was nice enough to help cook and prepare the pork intestine. He also made all the recommendations for what meats to get - was not disappointed with any of the choices. The Hite was also ice cold - perfect accompaniment with dinner. I will be back soon and save some room for a macaron ice cream sandwich...maybe! Well done Gen! The cool ambience, amazing food, and very friendly service leaves little competition in the Korean barbecue department.

review text: I love korean BBQ and since I was visiting family nearby, my cousin took me out to eat at this location since it was very close by and just recently opened. When we were ordering, we only saw Jade come by twice and she even passed by our table like she was ignoring us so I thought this was going to be a bad experience. However it got better when Phung started serving and the food came out quickly and was always making sure we had what we need for a satisfied meal. Phung is a friendly server so I definitely recommend sitting in his section if you can.  Despite how busy the place is, I think it's good to place to eat and you want nice servers to give you a great customer experience. Obviously the variety of meat has a wide range and the flavored soju is awesome. I would definitely come here again.

If you can put it away it's at a good price the meet and the quality is always good I have not once had a bad experience at any location.
